metadata.Title: CVE-2014-125019 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, was found in FFmpeg2.0. This affects the function decode_nal_unit of the component SliceSegment Handler. The manipulation leads to memory corruption. It ispossible to initiate the attack remotely. It is recommended to apply apatch to fix this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-125019` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libav-tools - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2').
